I not only lived in it after my mastectomy in 2007 but am posting this response from it right now while I recuperate from my reconstruction which was done on January 28th.Â  I would also recommend getting a body pillow (I got mine from bed/bath and beyond) to go with it. Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2007 10:37AM dfidayle wrote: I was just as shocked as everyone else when my mammogram came back clean but the ultra-sound found a "suspicous" shaded area which most thought was just dense breast tissue. WRONG! My radiologist told me that only 7 to 8% of cancers are not detected by mammogram. Welcome to the 8%! I just had a lumpectomy with sentinal node dissection and the tumor they thought was 2.5 centimeters is actually 4.5 centimeters and now I am facing a mastectomy. With every turn there seems to be something else that is a surprise. Good luck to all and God bless.
